author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਉਰਝਿ ਰਹਿਓ ਸਭ ਸੰਗਿ ਅਨੂਪ ਰੂਪਾਵਤੀ ॥

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: When someone's days are over, who can save him?

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਬੈਦਕ ਅਨਿਕ ਉਪਾਵ ਕਹਾਂ ਲਉ ਭਾਖਈ ॥

translation.text: How long can the physicians go on, suggesting various therapies?

transliteration.text: baidak anik upāv kahānh lau bhākhaī .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਏਕੋ ਚੇਤਿ ਗਵਾਰ ਕਾਜਿ ਤੇਰੈ ਆਵਈ ॥

translation.text: You fool, remember the One Lord; only He shall be of use to you in the end.

transliteration.text: ēkō chēt gavār kāj tērai āvaī .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਹਰਿਹਾਂ ਬਿਨੁ ਨਾਵੈ ਤਨੁ ਛਾਰੁ ਬ੍ਰਿਥਾ ਸਭੁ ਜਾਵਈ ॥੨੧॥

translation.text: O Lord! Without the Name, the body turns to dust, and everything goes to waste. ||21||

transliteration.text: harihānh bin nāvai tan shār brithā sabh jāvaī .21.

translation.text: Drink in the medicine of the Incomparable, Priceless Name.

transliteration.text: aukhadh nām apār amōlak pījaī .

translation.text: Meeting and joining together, the Saints drink it in, and give it to everyone.

transliteration.text: mil mil khāvah sant sagal kau dījaī .

translation.text: He alone is blessed with it, who is destined to receive it.

transliteration.text: jisai parāpat hōi tisai hī pāvanē .

translation.text: O Lord! I am a sacrifice to those who enjoy the Love of the Lord. ||22||

transliteration.text: harihānh hau balihārī tinnh j har rang rāvanē .22.

translation.text: The physicians meet together in their assembly.

translation.text: The medicines are effective, when the Lord Himself stands in their midst.

translation.text: Their good deeds and karma become apparent.
